hooks.Hook_Line: It’s 2 A.M., your kid is coughing again…do you grab your keys or this book?
hooks.Visual_Prompt: Bleary‑eyed mom in oversized T‑shirt, dark bedroom, dim lamp. She glances at her sleeping, coughing child, then at car keys on the nightstand. Next to the keys is The Forgotten Home Apothecary.
hooks.VO: It’s 2 A.M., your kid is coughing again…do you grab your keys or this book?
hooks.Audio / script: Soft, low ambient music. Gentle coughs from child, faint night sounds.

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Close‑up of the book cover on the nightstand. Mom’s hand chooses the book instead of the keys. She quietly opens to the apothecary‑style table of contents that looks like wooden shelves.
script_scenes.VO: This is The Forgotten Home Apothecary…250 kid‑safe natural remedies, laid out like an old apothecary so you can flip straight to COUGHS, FEVERS, EARACHES at 2 A.M.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Soft page‑turn sounds. Calm, reassuring female voice, late‑30s, mom‑next‑door tone.
script_scenes.Text Overlay: 250 remedies • Organized by COUGH, FEVER, EARACHE

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Over‑the‑shoulder shot: her finger traces the shelf image labeled “Respiratory → Cough.” Cut in to a remedy like “Jello Flu Shots” and “Penicillin Soup” with clear ingredients, dosage, and side effects boxes.
script_scenes.VO: Every remedy shows ingredients you recognize, step‑by‑step photos, exact dosages by age, plus side effects and interactions with meds, so you’re not guessing with your kids.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Subtle ticking clock in background, then soft whoosh as pages flip.
script_scenes.Text Overlay: Clear dosage • Side effects • Med interactions

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Kitchen in low light. Mom quietly stirs a small pot of Penicillin Soup or pours a Jello Flu Shot into a spoon. Gives it to her child, who settles back into bed, coughing less.
script_scenes.VO: Remedies like Penicillin Soup, Onion Socks for fevers, and Jello Flu Shots use pantry staples and inexpensive herbs…and cost pennies per dose.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Gentle clink of spoon on mug, soft exhale as child relaxes.
script_scenes.Text Overlay: Pennies per dose • Pantry ingredients

script_scenes.CTA_Line: Next time, reach for a remedy, not your car keys.
script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Mom turns off the lamp, sets the book on her nightstand with a bookmark in “Cough – Children.” Quick close‑up of the ornate cover and Dr. Nicole Apelian’s name. Finger points down to where a link would be.
script_scenes.VO: This is my 2 A.M. secret shelf. The Forgotten Home Apothecary lives by my bed now. Tap below to grab your copy before cold season hits.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Music swells slightly, then soft fade out.
script_scenes.Text Overlay: Tap to add this to your nightstand →

hooks.Concept: Revealing hidden remedies in an ordinary kitchen cabinet
hooks.Hook_Line: This is a kitchen cabinet. You think it only holds spices? Think again.
hooks.Visual_Prompt: Close-up of a hand opening an old wooden kitchen cabinet. Inside are familiar spice jars and pantry items. Gentle natural light. No face shown yet. On-screen text label top left: 'The Forgotten Home Apothecary' with small subtitle '250 Natural Remedies'.
hooks.VO: This is a kitchen cabinet. You think it only holds spices? Think again.
hooks.Audio / script: Soft, minimal acoustic music starts. Ambient kitchen sounds very low.
hooks.Text Overlay:
This is a kitchen cabinet.
Think it only holds spices?
Think again.

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Cut to Dr. Nicole Apelian seated at a wooden kitchen table. Warm, cozy lighting. Shelves behind her with labeled glass jars of herbs and the book 'The Forgotten Home Apothecary' standing upright. She’s a woman in her 50s, casual linen shirt, relaxed posture, friendly but confident tone, hands loosely folded, occasionally gesturing toward camera.
script_scenes.VO: I’m Dr. Nicole Apelian, herbalist and author of The Forgotten Home Apothecary, and what I’ve learned over 30 years in the field shocked me.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Music continues softly, no other sound effects.
script_scenes.Text Overlay:
Nicole Apelian, Ph.D.
Herbalist & Author

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Cut to overhead shot of a kitchen counter. Common items laid out: ginger root, honey, olive oil, oats, dried chamomile, a measuring spoon. Nicole’s hands move into frame, gently grouping items into small clusters labeled with subtle on-screen tags near each group (e.g., 'digestion', 'immune', 'joints', 'skin').
script_scenes.VO: Hidden in everyday herbs and pantry staples are remedies that can help calm nerves, soothe digestion, support immunity, ease joint stiffness, and even care for your skin.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Soft page-turn sound as labels appear; music steady.
script_scenes.Text Overlay: Everyday remedies hiding in plain sight

script_scenes.Visual_Prompt: Medium shot of Nicole at the counter, calmly preparing a simple remedy: pouring hot water over herbs in a jar, adding honey, placing a label on the jar. The open book lies beside her, showing a full-color remedy page with photos and step-by-step instructions. Camera slowly dollies in.
script_scenes.VO: In this short video, I’ll show you how to turn simple ingredients you already own into safe, step-by-step remedies for your whole family—without prescriptions, gatekeepers, or expensive products.
script_scenes.Audio / script: Quiet clink of glass jar and spoon under the music.
script_scenes.Text Overlay:
Step-by-step remedies
No prescriptions • No gatekeepers

script_scenes.CTA_Line: Click to see how to build your own home apothecary.
